ai-atk-s0501a6:140_3: There I sprinkled water on the lotuses of various blossoms, and covered with flowers out of season.
ai-atk-s0501a6:140_4: I sprinkled the ground all round with water from my water pitcher.
ai-atk-s0501a6:140_5: I erected my robe, and bound the parasols to the shrine for my sun. It was six days until my bodies were chopped off.
ai-atk-s0501a6:140_6: And so, mendicants, this worship and respect wasn’t given up through the power of the Buddha, because of the power of Brahmā, he was no more future lives.”
ai-atk-s0501a6:141_0: “If, by renouncing a small good, he might see a good that is large,
ai-atk-s0501a6:142_0: a wise one would give up material happiness and discernment.”
ai-atk-s0501a6:143_0: Except in the ultimate talk, lesser training,
